title: Research the Company and Interviewers
description: Understanding key information about the company and interviewers can help you go into your interview with confidence. Use the company’s website, social media posts, and recent press releases to gain insight into the company’s goals and values.

title: Practice Your Interview Answers
description: Prepare your answer to the common question: “Tell me about yourself, and why are you interested in this role with our company?” Practice communicating who you are and the value you’ll bring to the company and the role. Craft a compelling elevator pitch.

title: Use the STAR Method
description: Prepare to answer questions about past experiences using the STAR method. Structure your responses with a clear Situation, Task, Action, and Result to effectively communicate your skills and achievements.

title: Plan to Arrive 10–15 Minutes Early
description: Map out your route to the interview location in advance. Consider doing a practice run before the interview day. If using public transportation, have a backup plan for potential delays or closures.

title: Make a Great First Impression
description: Pay attention to details like shining your shoes, ensuring clean and tidy nails, and checking your clothes for any issues. Present yourself professionally and don’t forget to smile.

title: Treat Everyone with Respect
description: Show respect to everyone you encounter, including those on the road, parking lot attendants, security personnel, and front desk staff. Treat everyone as though they could be the hiring manager.

title: Respond Truthfully to Questions Asked
description: Honesty is appreciated by interviewers. Focus on your genuine strengths and qualifications for the position. Avoid exaggeration and provide truthful responses.

title: Keep Your Answers Concise and Focused
description: Respect the limited time with each interviewer by keeping your answers concise. Practice beforehand to avoid rambling and ensure your responses are clear and focused.
